meanings.definition: Going away from a particular place
meanings.sent1: The outbound train was leaving the station.
meanings.sent2: The outbound flight departed on time.
meanings.sent3: The outbound bus seemed to be in a hurry to leave.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were outbound, drifting far away.
meanings.sent5: The outbound ship sailed into the sunset, disappearing over the horizon.

meanings.sent1: The outbound passengers waved goodbye to their families.
meanings.sent2: The outbound car drove off into the distance.
meanings.sent3: The outbound cat snuck out of the house when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: His dreams were outbound, seeking new adventures.
meanings.sent5: The outbound hikers set off on their journey, full of excitement.

meanings.definition: Traveling in a specific direction away from a point
meanings.sent1: The outbound traffic was heavy during rush hour.
meanings.sent2: The outbound road led to the neighboring town.
meanings.sent3: The outbound ants marched in a straight line towards their nest.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was outbound, echoing through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The outbound river flowed steadily towards the sea, carrying boats along its path.
